newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine MetroGas to sell $62.5 mln bond Dec 2.
newsitem.headline: Argentine MetroGas to sell $62.5 mln bond Dec 2.

text.p: Argentina's largest gas distribution company MetroGas SA said Thursday its planned $62.5 million in variable rate four-year bonds will be issued Dec 2.

The gas distributor added in a statement Swiss Bank Corporation and a group of other banks bought the bonds on Wednesday. Under the agreement of purchase with the banks, the bonds will be issued on December 2.

Interest on the bond will be LIBOR plus 138 basis points in the first year, LIBOR plus 188 basis points in the second, LIBOR plus 213 basis points in the third year and LIBOR plus 238 basis points in the last year of the life of the bond.
British Gas PLC is the operator of MetroGas.
The income from the bond will be used to refinance short-term bank debt. The issue is part of the firm's global bond program approved in 1994.
